image.title: The latest news from News Center.

item.title: Adobe Shockwave Player removal from Windows PCs Thursday, March 31
item.creator: hward
item.description: The Core Computing Division will be removing Adobe Shockwave Player from all Fermilab-owned centrally managed Windows PCs, excluding Accelerator Division PCs, starting on Thursday, March 31, at 11 a.m. In addition to posing potential security risks, Adobe Shockwave Player is no longer in use and has caused sporadic issues with Internet Explorer. This maintenance should be transparent and does not require any action. Please contact the Service Desk if you have any questions.
item.comment: The Core Computing Division will be removing Adobe Shockwave Player from all Fermilab-owned centrally managed Windows PCs, excluding Accelerator Division PCs, starting on Thursday, March 31, at 11 a.m. In addition to posing potential security risks, Adobe Shockwave Player is no longer in use and has caused sporadic issues with Internet Explorer. This maintenance should be transparent and does not require any action. Please contact the Service Desk if you have any questions.

item.title: Symantec client upgrade starting Wednesday, March 30
item.creator: hward
item.description: The Core Computing Division will be upgrading the Symantec client, which is responsible for software security and antivirus protection, on all Fermilab-owned Windows desktops and laptops. Servers and Accelerator Division computers will not be included in this upgrade. The upgrade will take place from Wednesday, March 30 at 11 a.m. through Thursday, April 7, at 5 p.m. This upgrade will run in the background and is expected to be nondisruptive. If you have any questions, please contact the Service Desk.
item.comment: The Core Computing Division will be upgrading the Symantec client, which is responsible for software security and antivirus protection, on all Fermilab-owned Windows desktops and laptops. Servers and Accelerator Division computers will not be included in this upgrade. The upgrade will take place from Wednesday, March 30 at 11 a.m. through Thursday, April 7, at 5 p.m. This upgrade will run in the background and is expected to be nondisruptive. If you have any questions, please contact the Service Desk.

item.title: Time for prairie renewal
item.creator: georgia
item.description: This photo of a prairie burn was taken on the afternoon of March 20, across the road from the bison.
item.comment: This photo of a prairie burn was taken on the afternoon of March 20, across the road from the bison. Photo: Georgia Schwender, OC

item.title: The Milky Way’s hot spot
item.creator: leah
item.description: The center of our galaxy is a busy place. But it might be one of the best sites to hunt for dark matter.
item.comment: The center of our galaxy is a busy place. But it might be one of the best sites to hunt for dark matter.

item.title: Tractor/Lawn Mower
item.creator: zagel
item.description: Ford YT-16 Tractor for sale. 16 Horsepower 2-Cylinder Briggs Engine. Includes 48”Mower Deck and Snow Plow. Call x4076, or zagel@fnal.gov
item.comment: Ford YT-16 Tractor for sale. 16 Horsepower 2-Cylinder Briggs Engine. Includes 48”Mower Deck and Snow Plow. Call x4076, or zagel@fnal.gov

item.title: 2013 Trail Runner 29RK by Heartland
item.creator: wredling
item.description: Like new, well maintained 2013 Trail Runner 29RK Hartland camper. Low miles on tires, new hitch with 2 5/16 ball, wheel chocks and sway bars, 15′ electric wind flex awning, oversize slide out (dinette and sofa sleeper), two swivel rockers, sleeps 4-6, bathroom with enclosed shower stall, neutral colors. In Batavia, $16,800. Call Ralph at (630) 624-3909.
item.comment:
Like new, well maintained 2013 Trail Runner 29RK Hartland camper. Low miles on tires, new hitch with 2 5/16 ball, wheel chocks and sway bars, 15′ electric wind flex awning, oversize slide out (dinette and sofa sleeper), two swivel rockers, sleeps 4-6, bathroom with enclosed shower stall, neutral colors. In Batavia, $16,800. Call Ralph at (630) 624-3909.

item.title: Sunburst
item.creator: mccrory
item.description: The cornice of the red barn near FZero makes contact with the center of the sun.
item.comment: The cornice of the red barn near FZero makes contact with the center of the sun. Photo: Elliott McCrory, AD

item.title: Video: Small particles, big science: the international LBNF/DUNE project
item.creator: leah
item.description: This new, two-minute animation shows how the Long-Baseline Neutrino Facility will power the Deep Underground Neutrino Experiment to help scientists understand the role neutrinos play in the universe.
item.comment: This new, two-minute animation shows how the Long-Baseline Neutrino Facility will power the Deep Underground Neutrino Experiment to help scientists understand the role neutrinos play in the universe.

item.title: In memoriam: Richard H. Milburn
item.creator: leah
item.description: Former Fermilab MINOS collaborator Richard H. Milburn passed away on Dec. 7, 2015. He was a professor of physics emeritus at Tufts University. An innovative experimental physicist, he spent a lifetime of research on particle physics with collaborators at Fermilab, including the MINOS neutrino experiment in the 1990s. A memorial at Tufts University’s Physics and Astronomy Department is planned for April 11. Read Milburn’s obituary. Read the Tufts University obituary for Milburn.
item.comment:
Former Fermilab MINOS collaborator Richard H. Milburn passed away on Dec. 7, 2015. He was a professor of physics emeritus at Tufts University. An innovative experimental physicist, he spent a lifetime of research on particle physics with collaborators at Fermilab, including the MINOS neutrino experiment in the 1990s.

A memorial at Tufts University’s Physics and Astronomy Department is planned for April 11.

Read Milburn’s obituary .

Read the Tufts University obituary for Milburn.
